what: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University
title: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University
text: GEO712PACKAGE test R package created GEO712 course McMaster University (fall term 2023). R package share processed data multiple regression model. use data set Kaggle, named “House Sales King County, USA”, predict house price using regression model. data set contains house sales prices King County, includes Seattle. includes homes sold May 2014 May 2015, 21,613 registers 21 variables regarding houses sold.

title: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University
text: can install development version GEO712PACKAGE GitHub :

title: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University
text: basic example shows access data files. First, ’ll need call library “GEO712PACKAGE: Accessing data: Visualizing summary data: Now, already access data can create graphs data. next chunk shows house prices predicted compared real values:
code: library(GEO712PACKAGE) data(df) houses <- df summary(houses) #>      price            bedrooms        bathrooms      sqft_living    #>  Min.   :  75000   Min.   : 0.000   Min.   :0.000   Min.   :  290   #>  1st Qu.: 321500   1st Qu.: 3.000   1st Qu.:1.750   1st Qu.: 1425   #>  Median : 450000   Median : 3.000   Median :2.250   Median : 1910   #>  Mean   : 539157   Mean   : 3.369   Mean   :2.114   Mean   : 2079   #>  3rd Qu.: 645000   3rd Qu.: 4.000   3rd Qu.:2.500   3rd Qu.: 2550   #>  Max.   :5570000   Max.   :11.000   Max.   :8.000   Max.   :13540   #>     sqft_lot           floors        waterfront            view        #>  Min.   :    520   Min.   :1.000   Min.   :0.000000   Min.   :0.0000   #>  1st Qu.:   5040   1st Qu.:1.000   1st Qu.:0.000000   1st Qu.:0.0000   #>  Median :   7617   Median :1.500   Median :0.000000   Median :0.0000   #>  Mean   :  15105   Mean   :1.494   Mean   :0.007497   Mean   :0.2339   #>  3rd Qu.:  10685   3rd Qu.:2.000   3rd Qu.:0.000000   3rd Qu.:0.0000   #>  Max.   :1651359   Max.   :3.500   Max.   :1.000000   Max.   :4.0000   #>    condition         grade          sqft_above   sqft_basement    #>  Min.   :1.000   Min.   : 1.000   Min.   : 290   Min.   :   0.0   #>  1st Qu.:3.000   1st Qu.: 7.000   1st Qu.:1190   1st Qu.:   0.0   #>  Median :3.000   Median : 7.000   Median :1560   Median :   0.0   #>  Mean   :3.409   Mean   : 7.656 predicted_values  #>  Min.   :1900   Min.   :-609969   #>  1st Qu.:1951   1st Qu.: 342064   #>  Median :1975   Median : 479850   #>  Mean   :1971   Mean   : 539157   #>  3rd Qu.:1997   3rd Qu.: 669496   #>  Max.   :2015   Max.   :3126792 plot(x = houses$predicted_values, y = houses$price, ylab = "House Price ($)", xlab = "Price ($) Predicted", col='red', cex = 0.5, pch = 19) + abline(lm(houses$price ~ houses$predicted_values), lwd=2, col='blue') #> integer(0)

what: GEO712PACKAGE: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University — GEO712PACKAGE-package
title: GEO712PACKAGE: A R package for the GEO712 course at McMAster University — GEO712PACKAGE-package
text: R package, share data processed multiple linear regression. used data data science platform Kaggle, called "House Sales King County, USA", predict price houses sold US cities using regression model. dataset contains house sale prices King County, includes Seattle. includes homes sold May 2014 May 2015, 21,613 records 21 variables relating homes sold.
